title: Add a favicon (image icon) next to the website name in the browser tab

requirements.text: Add support for a site icon (favicon) so an image appears next to the website name in the browser tab by referencing favicon assets from the HTML head.

quotes: also can I upload an image for next to the website names?

acceptanceCriteria: The browser tab shows a custom icon next to the title when loading the site.
`frontend/index.html` includes appropriate `<link rel="icon" ...>` tag(s) pointing to static image asset(s) served by the frontend.
The favicon works in modern browsers (Chrome, Safari, Firefox) without requiring any backend changes.

requirements.text: Add the favicon image files as static assets in the frontend so they are included in the build output and can be referenced directly from `frontend/index.html`.

quotes: can I upload an image for next to the website names?

acceptanceCriteria: Favicon image files exist under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and are accessible via direct URL paths after build (e.g., `/assets/generated/...`).
`frontend/index.html` references the new favicon asset paths and no broken network requests occur for favicon assets.

constraints: Do not change the site URL/subdomain (e.g., the autogenerated caffeine.xyz link remains unchanged).
Do not modify any files under the immutable frontend paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (compose components instead).
Keep all changes limited to the frontend; no backend schema/state changes are required.
nonGoals: Implementing custom domain connection for dinigc.com (DNS/canister domain setup).
Adding an in-app UI for users to dynamically upload/change the site favicon at runtime.

required: Flat app icon for mobile bookmarks (dinigc-apple-touch-icon.dim_180x180.png)
